studyTitle: Pentadecapeptide BPC 157 and its effects on gastrointestinal healing and angiogenesis
abstract: BPC 157 accelerates healing of transected Achilles tendon, transected quadriceps muscle, and crushed muscle. The peptide exhibits angiogenic properties and promotes granulation tissue formation. It modulates growth hormone receptor expression and improves tendon-to-bone healing.
dosing: 250-500 mcg subcutaneous or oral twice daily; cycle 4-8 weeks

sources.title: BPC 157 and gastrointestinal healing: systematic review
Pentadecapeptide BPC 157 and tendon-to-bone healing in rats
BPC 157 angiogenic effects in muscle injury model

studyTitle: Thymosin β4 promotes dermal wound repair and regeneration
abstract: TB-500 accelerates wound healing through increased cell migration, angiogenesis, and collagen deposition. Significant improvement in tensile strength of healed tissue. Promotes stem cell migration and differentiation.
dosing: 2.5-5 mg subcutaneous 2x/week; cycle 6-8 weeks

sources.title: Thymosin β4 and dermal wound repair: clinical perspectives
TB-500 promotes collagen deposition in rat tendon model

studyTitle: Epithalamin (epitalon) extends lifespan and suppresses tumor development in aged mice
abstract: Epitalon restores melatonin rhythm and extends mean lifespan. Reduces spontaneous tumor incidence and normalizes immune function in elderly subjects. Increases telomerase activity in human cell cultures.
dosing: 10 mg subcutaneous daily; 20-day cycles, 3-4x per year

sources.title: Epitalon extends lifespan and suppresses tumors in aged mice
Telomerase activity and pineal peptides: systematic review

studyTitle: Copper peptide GHK-Cu in skin repair and anti-aging
abstract: GHK-Cu stimulates collagen and elastin synthesis, promotes wound healing, and exhibits antioxidant activity. Improves skin firmness and reduces fine lines. Modulates gene expression for tissue repair.
dosing: Topical 0.1-1% cream; or 1-2 mg subcutaneous 2-3x/week

sources.title: GHK-Cu in skin repair: randomized controlled trial
Copper peptides and collagen synthesis: meta-analysis

studyTitle: Semaglutide 2.4 mg for weight management: STEP trials
abstract: Once-weekly semaglutide 2.4 mg produces sustained weight loss and improvement in cardiometabolic risk factors in adults with obesity. Reduces HbA1c and cardiovascular events in type 2 diabetes.
dosing: 0.25 mg weekly, titrate to 2.4 mg over 16-20 weeks; maintenance 2.4 mg weekly

sources.title: STEP 1: Semaglutide 2.4 mg for obesity—phase 3 RCT
Semaglutide and cardiovascular outcomes in type 2 diabetes
GLP-1 receptor agonists for weight management: systematic review

studyTitle: Dual GIP/GLP-1 agonist tirzepatide for type 2 diabetes and obesity
abstract: Tirzepatide achieves superior HbA1c and body weight reduction vs semaglutide. Cardiovascular outcomes and safety profile support long-term use. Dual receptor agonism enhances metabolic effects.
dosing: 2.5 mg weekly, titrate to 5-15 mg over 20 weeks; maintenance 5-15 mg weekly

sources.title: SURPASS-2: Tirzepatide vs semaglutide in type 2 diabetes
SURMOUNT-1: Tirzepatide for obesity—phase 3 trial
Dual GIP/GLP-1 agonists: mechanism and clinical use

studyTitle: Selective growth hormone secretagogue: ipamorelin and GH release
abstract: Ipamorelin selectively stimulates GH release without affecting cortisol or prolactin. Promotes lean mass retention and fat loss in clinical trials. Minimal side effects due to selectivity.
dosing: 200-300 mcg subcutaneous 1-2x daily; cycle 8-12 weeks

sources.title: Ipamorelin and GH release: double-blind placebo-controlled study
Selective GHS and cortisol sparing: comparative review

studyTitle: Long-acting growth hormone releasing hormone analog CJC-1295
abstract: CJC-1295 extends half-life of GHRH and sustains elevated GH and IGF-1 for days. Well tolerated with dose-dependent increases in IGF-1. Single dose maintains elevated GH for 6+ days.
dosing: 1-2 mg subcutaneous 1-2x per week; cycle 8-12 weeks

sources.title: CJC-1295 pharmacokinetics and IGF-1 in healthy adults
Long-acting GHRH analogs: clinical applications

studyTitle: Melanotan II: pharmacokinetics and effects on pigmentation
abstract: MT-II induces melanogenesis and erectile activity via MC receptor agonism. Single-dose pharmacokinetics support subcutaneous administration. Tanning effects with reduced UV exposure.
dosing: 0.5-1 mg subcutaneous daily for loading; maintenance 1-2x/week

sources.title: Melanotan II pharmacokinetics and pigmentation
MC receptor agonists: pharmacology and safety

studyTitle: Thymosin α1 as an immunomodulatory agent in viral infections and cancer
abstract: Ta1 enhances T-cell maturation and cytokine production. Improves outcomes in chronic hepatitis B/C and as adjuvant in cancer immunotherapy. Restores immune function in immunocompromised patients.
dosing: 1.6 mg subcutaneous 2x/week; cycle 4-12 weeks depending on indication

sources.title: Thymosin α1 in chronic hepatitis B: meta-analysis
Ta1 as adjuvant in cancer immunotherapy: phase 2 trial

studyTitle: Semax: nootropic and neuroprotective peptide
abstract: Semax improves cognitive function, memory, and attention. Neuroprotective in ischemia and stress. Modulates BDNF and endorphin systems. Used in stroke recovery and cognitive enhancement.
dosing: 200-800 mcg intranasal or subcutaneous daily; cycle 2-4 weeks

sources.title: Semax in acute stroke: randomized controlled trial
ACTH(4-10) fragment peptides: neuroprotection review

studyTitle: Selank: anxiolytic and nootropic peptide
abstract: Selank reduces anxiety and improves learning. Modulates serotonin and immune system. Antidepressant-like effects in animal models. Enhances GABA and reduces anxiety without sedation.
dosing: 200-400 mcg intranasal or subcutaneous daily; cycle 2-4 weeks

sources.title: Selank in generalized anxiety: pilot RCT
Immunomodulatory peptides and anxiety: systematic review

studyTitle: Dihexa: hepatocyte growth factor mimetic for cognitive enhancement
abstract: Dihexa crosses blood-brain barrier and promotes neurogenesis. Enhances memory and synaptic connectivity. Hepatocyte growth factor mimetic with potential in Alzheimer's and cognitive decline.
dosing: 10-50 mg oral daily; cycle 4-8 weeks

sources.title: Dihexa and hippocampal neurogenesis in rodent model
HGF mimetics in cognitive disorders: review

studyTitle: PTN-166 (P7C3): neuroprotective compound and neurogenesis
abstract: PTN-166 promotes hippocampal neurogenesis and protects neurons from cell death. Improves cognitive function in models of neurodegeneration. Enhances NAD+ and mitochondrial function.
dosing: Research phase; oral dosing in development

sources.title: P7C3 compounds and neurogenesis in mouse model
Neuroprotective small molecules: NAD+ and mitochondria

studyTitle: AOD-9604: fragment of growth hormone for fat metabolism
abstract: AOD-9604 is a modified fragment of GH that stimulates fat metabolism without growth effects. Promotes lipolysis and reduces body fat in clinical studies. No effect on blood sugar or IGF-1.
dosing: 300-500 mcg subcutaneous daily; cycle 8-12 weeks

sources.title: AOD-9604 for obesity: phase 2 randomized trial
GH fragments and lipolysis: mechanism review

studyTitle: Growth Hormone Releasing Peptide-2: GH secretion and body composition
abstract: GHRP-2 stimulates GH release via ghrelin receptor. Increases lean mass and fat oxidation. Less appetite stimulation than GHRP-6. Improves sleep quality and recovery.
dosing: 100-300 mcg subcutaneous 1-3x daily; cycle 8-16 weeks

sources.title: GHRP-2 and GH secretion in healthy adults

studyTitle: GHRP-6: GH secretagogue with appetite stimulation
abstract: GHRP-6 potent GH release via ghrelin receptor agonism. Strong appetite stimulation (useful for bulking). Increases GH pulse amplitude. Improves collagen synthesis.
dosing: 100-300 mcg subcutaneous 1-3x daily; cycle 8-16 weeks

sources.title: GHRP-6 appetite and GH effects in clinical study

studyTitle: Hexarelin: cardioprotective GH secretagogue
abstract: Hexarelin strongest GH releaser of GHRPs. Cardioprotective effects independent of GH. May increase cortisol/prolactin at high doses. Desensitization occurs with chronic use.
dosing: 100-200 mcg subcutaneous 1-2x daily; cycle 4-8 weeks (desensitization risk)

sources.title: Hexarelin cardioprotection in ischemia model

studyTitle: MK-677: oral ghrelin mimetic for sustained GH elevation
abstract: MK-677 is oral GH secretagogue with 24+ hour duration. Increases IGF-1 and lean mass. Improves sleep quality and bone density. May increase appetite and insulin resistance.
dosing: 10-25 mg oral once daily (preferably before bed); cycle 8-16 weeks

sources.title: MK-677 in elderly: body composition and IGF-1
Ibutamoren sleep and GH in young adults

studyTitle: Tesamorelin: GHRH analog for visceral adiposity
abstract: Tesamorelin FDA-approved for HIV-associated lipodystrophy. Reduces visceral fat without affecting subcutaneous fat. Improves insulin sensitivity and lipid profiles. Sustained GH elevation.
dosing: 2 mg subcutaneous daily; indefinite use in approved indications

sources.title: Tesamorelin for visceral adiposity in HIV: RCT

studyTitle: Sermorelin: GHRH 1-29 for physiologic GH restoration
abstract: Sermorelin is bioidentical GHRH fragment (1-29). Restores physiologic GH pulsatility. Safer long-term profile than exogenous GH. Improves sleep, recovery, and body composition.
dosing: 200-500 mcg subcutaneous before bed; long-term use typical

sources.title: Sermorelin long-term safety in aging adults

studyTitle: Liraglutide: GLP-1 agonist for diabetes and weight management
abstract: Liraglutide (Saxenda/Victoza) GLP-1 agonist for T2DM and obesity. Daily injection with dose titration. Cardiovascular benefits demonstrated in LEADER trial. Weight loss ~8-12% at 3.0 mg dose.
dosing: 0.6 mg daily, titrate to 3.0 mg over 4-5 weeks; maintenance 3.0 mg daily

sources.title: LEADER: Liraglutide cardiovascular outcomes in T2DM

studyTitle: Retatrutide: triple agonist for metabolic disease
abstract: Retatrutide triple GIP/GLP-1/glucagon agonist. Superior weight loss vs tirzepatide in phase 2 (~24% at 48 weeks). Improved metabolic markers. Potential game-changer in obesity treatment.
dosing: Phase 3 trials ongoing; 8-12 mg weekly projected maintenance

sources.title: Retatrutide phase 2: triple agonist for obesity

studyTitle: HGH Fragment 176-191: lipolytic fragment without growth effects
abstract: Frag 176-191 is C-terminal fragment of GH. Promotes lipolysis without IGF-1 elevation. No effect on glucose or insulin. Targeted fat loss without growth-related side effects.
dosing: 250-500 mcg subcutaneous daily or 5x/week; cycle 12-16 weeks

sources.title: HGH fragment and lipolysis in obesity model

studyTitle: KPV: anti-inflammatory tripeptide
abstract: KPV (Lys-Pro-Val) is C-terminal fragment of alpha-MSH. Potent anti-inflammatory via NF-κB inhibition. Oral bioavailable. Benefits in IBD and inflammatory conditions.
dosing: 500-2000 mcg oral or subcutaneous daily; cycle 4-8 weeks

sources.title: KPV in ulcerative colitis: pilot study

studyTitle: LL-37: antimicrobial peptide with immune modulation
abstract: LL-37 human cathelicidin antimicrobial peptide. Broad-spectrum antimicrobial and immunomodulatory effects. Wound healing and tissue repair. Potential in resistant infections.
dosing: 200-400 mcg subcutaneous daily; cycle 4-8 weeks

sources.title: LL-37 antimicrobial and wound healing properties

studyTitle: Bremelanotide: melanocortin agonist for sexual dysfunction
abstract: PT-141 FDA-approved for hypoactive sexual desire disorder. MC4R agonist affecting CNS pathways. Improved arousal and desire in clinical trials. Alternative to PDE5 inhibitors.
dosing: 1.75 mg subcutaneous as needed (at least 45 min before); max 8 doses/month

sources.title: Bremelanotide for HSDD in women: phase 3 trials

studyTitle: Noopept: nootropic peptide with neuroprotection
abstract: Noopept dipeptide prodrug of cycloprolylglycine. Enhances memory, learning, and cognition. Neuroprotective via NGF/BDNF modulation. Well-tolerated cognitive enhancer.
dosing: 10-30 mg oral daily; cycle 4-8 weeks

sources.title: Noopept cognitive effects in mild cognitive impairment

studyTitle: NSI-189: neurogenic compound for depression
abstract: NSI-189 stimulates hippocampal neurogenesis. Antidepressant effects in clinical trials. Increases hippocampal volume. Potential in major depressive disorder and cognitive decline.
dosing: 40 mg oral twice daily; clinical trials used 12-week courses

sources.title: NSI-189 in major depression: phase 2 trial

studyTitle: Cerebrolysin: neurotrophic peptide mixture for stroke and dementia
abstract: Cerebrolysin porcine brain-derived peptides with neurotrophic effects. Improves outcomes in stroke, traumatic brain injury, and dementia. BDNF-like properties. Used clinically in many countries.
dosing: 10-30 mL IV daily for 10-20 days; repeat courses as needed

sources.title: Cerebrolysin in acute ischemic stroke: meta-analysis

studyTitle: IGF-1 Long R3: extended half-life insulin-like growth factor
abstract: IGF-1 LR3 modified IGF-1 with reduced IGFBP binding. Extended half-life and systemic effects. Promotes muscle growth and fat loss. Potent anabolic effects with hyperplasia potential.
dosing: 20-100 mcg subcutaneous daily; cycle 4-8 weeks (use cautiously)

sources.title: IGF-1 variants and muscle hypertrophy in animal models

studyTitle: Mechano Growth Factor: splice variant of IGF-1 for muscle repair
abstract: MGF mechanically-induced IGF-1 splice variant. Activates satellite cells and promotes muscle repair. Released during muscle damage. Synergistic with IGF-1 for hypertrophy.
dosing: 100-200 mcg subcutaneous post-workout; 3-5x/week for 4-8 weeks

sources.title: MGF and satellite cell activation in muscle injury

studyTitle: DSIP: sleep modulation and stress adaptation
abstract: DSIP modulates sleep architecture and stress hormones. Improves sleep quality and reduces cortisol. Adaptogenic properties. May enhance resilience to physical/mental stress.
dosing: 100-200 mcg subcutaneous before bed; cycle 2-4 weeks

sources.title: DSIP sleep and stress modulation: review

studyTitle: Humanin: mitochondrial-derived peptide for longevity
abstract: Humanin mitochondrial peptide with cytoprotective effects. Protects against Alzheimer's, diabetes, and aging. Improves insulin sensitivity. Declines with age. Potential longevity intervention.
dosing: Research phase; subcutaneous dosing in development

sources.title: Humanin in aging and age-related diseases

studyTitle: MOTS-c: mitochondrial peptide for metabolic health
abstract: MOTS-c mitochondrial ORF peptide regulating metabolism. Improves insulin sensitivity and exercise capacity. Protects against metabolic dysfunction. Potential in diabetes and obesity.
dosing: 5-15 mg subcutaneous 1-3x/week; research ongoing

sources.title: MOTS-c and metabolic homeostasis in mice

studyTitle: Elamipretide: mitochondrial-targeted peptide
abstract: SS-31 targets inner mitochondrial membrane. Protects cardiolipin and improves mitochondrial function. Clinical trials in heart failure, Barth syndrome. Potent anti-aging potential.
dosing: Clinical trials use 4-40 mg IV or subcutaneous daily

sources.title: Elamipretide in Barth syndrome: phase 2 trial
